cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (105 km) west of Cabo Cruz, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Cuba, then north-northwest into the eastern Gulf, turning northeast along the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (near Cedar Key-Tampa area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches/warnings confined to Cuba, Florida Keys, and Florida west coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings Cuba; Hurricane watch portions of central Cuba; tropical-storm warnings Florida Keys/Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, Georgia/Carolinas coastline, then Mid-Atlantic and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Thursday night into Friday with tropical-storm gusts unlikely (≤34 kt probability only 3%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Delaware River/Upper Delaware Bay near Philadelphia
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain could bring 1–2 inches (isolated 3 in) Friday, producing localized ponding and minor river rises
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado risk, mainly south of the port; possible brief navigation restrictions on Delaware River during heaviest rain/wind
